Package command

Class ListEventsCommand

java.lang.Object
command.ListEventsCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICommand<java.util.List<Event>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ListEventsMaxDistanceCommand
public class ListEventsCommand
extends java.lang.Object
implements ICommand<java.util.List<Event>>
ListEventsCommand allows anyone to get a list of Events available on the system. Optionally, users can specify a particular LocalDate to look up events for.

  • Constructor Details

    • ListEventsCommand

      public ListEventsCommand​(boolean userEventsOnly, boolean activeEventsOnly, java.time.LocalDate searchDate)
      Parameters:
      userEventsOnly - if true, the returned events will be filtered depending on the logged-in user: for Staffs only the Events they have created, and for Consumers only the Events that match their EventTagCollection
      activeEventsOnly - if true, returned Events will be filtered to contain only Events with EventStatus.ACTIVE
      searchDate - chosen date to look for events. Can be null. If not null, only Events that are happening on searchDate (i.e., starting, ending, or in between) will be included

  • Method Details

    • eventSatisfiesPreferences

      public static boolean eventSatisfiesPreferences​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​EventTag> possibleTags, EventTagCollection preferences, Event event)
      Checks event statisfies user preferences
      Parameters:
      possibleTags - tags for event
      preferences - preferences for user
      event - event to check
      Returns:
      true if the event satisfies the preferences, false otherwise

    • execute

      public void execute​(Context context, IView view)
      Description copied from interface: ICommand
      This method should not be called directly outside of testing. Normal usage is to create a command object and execute it by passing to Controller.runCommand(ICommand) instead.
      Specified by:
      execute in interface ICommand<java.util.List<Event>>
      Parameters:
      context - object that provides access to global application state
      view - allows passing information to the user interface
